body:
You need to follow Electron's documents to install native modules:
https://github.com/atom/electron/blob/master/docs/tutorial/using-native-node-modules.md

There is also a module to simplify the progress:
https://github.com/paulcbetts/electron-rebuild

I went through the electron-rebuild process, but still encounter the same issue. Is that approach going to work with electron-prebuilt? Console output below:

```
C:\...\app>npm install --save-dev electron-rebuild
npm ERR! fetch failed https://atom.io/download/atom-shell/nan-1.6.1.tgz
/
> nslog@2.0.0 install C:\...\app\node_modules\electron-rebuild\node_modules\nslog
> node-gyp rebuild

p-bin\\..\..\node_modules\node-gyp\bin\node-gyp.js" rebuild

> npm ERR! fetch failed https://atom.io/download/atom-shell/nan-1.6.1.tgz

There is some networking error according to the log, it should be related to Atom 1 release a few days ago. You might try running `npm install --save-dev electron-rebuild` again.

Thanks for the followup. I tried again and I'm still seeing the same issue.

I've put together a minimal repro at this repository: https://github.com/gisenberg/electron-2061

`repro.ps1` contains the commands I'm running:

```
apm install
npm install electron-rebuild --save-dev
.\node_modules\.bin\electron-rebuild .
.\node_modules\.bin\electron .
```

Here's the output of running `repro.ps1` with a cloned repository:

```
PS C:\Users\Gabriel\Development\test> .\repro.ps1
Installing modules done
npm WARN package.json electron-test@0.1.0 No repository field.

@gisenberg You should remove `node_modules` and try again, `npm` does not work well with partial-installed modules.
I've removed node_modules and all relevant caches, but still see the same issue.
You don't need to run `apm install`.
Removed `apm install`, replaced with `npm install`, still seeing the same behavior.
